content: The "Child Care Affordability Act of 2007" allows for a deduction for expenses related to household and dependent care services necessary for gainful employment under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Child Care Affordability Act of 2007" allows individuals with qualifying dependents to deduct employment-related expenses up to $13,000 for one qualifying individual or 200 percent of that amount for two or more qualifying individuals. Definitions and special rules are provided for qualifying individuals and employment-related expenses. The "Child Care Affordability Act of 2007" allows deductions for employment-related expenses up to $13,000 for one qualifying individual or 200 percent of that amount for two or more qualifying individuals. Coordination with other programs and special rules apply. The tax code allows a spouse who is a student or unable to care for themselves to be considered gainfully employed with earned income for each month they are a full-time student or a qualifying individual. This applies to only one spouse in a husband and wife situation. The tax code allows one spouse to be considered gainfully employed with earned income for each month, with special rules similar to other subsections. An inflation adjustment increases the dollar amount annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The tax code allows for rounding amounts to the next lowest multiple of $100 if not already a multiple of $100. The Secretary will create necessary regulations for this section.
